fields_of_interest: Trade, Culture, Education and training, Energy, Environment, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Research and innovation, External Relations
head_office_address: EIRG CMES, Lund University c/o Rouzbeh Parsi
eu_initiatives: As much as possible we follow relations between the EU (EEAS, Commission and Parliament) and Iran. WE participate where possible with experts on trade, foreign policy, Iranian domestic policies, and research and education.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit:
Vision: Through research, training programs, exchanges and facilitation, EIRG aims to promote greater understanding and interaction between Iran and European Countries. We aim to support sustainable development and cooperation through close cooperation between stakeholders across sectors. 
Mission: A strong relationship between European countries and Iran that fosters dialogue, mutual respect, and sustainable development.
inter_groups:
Iran committee and AFET. 
Most recently we wrote an in-depth study for the policy department of Parliament: "An EU Strategy for relations with Iran after the nuclear deal", June 2016
relevant_communication: We regularly organise briefings for Parliament and EEAS on Iran-related subjects. We facilitate interaction and exchange between the parties, often through policy relevant conferences with European and Iranian officials, experts, academics, and politicians.
